content: This popped above the left hand channel menu and I can't get rid of it.
Try quitting your app and restarting. If you are using Discord in your browser, clear your browsing history and reload the page.
I got it too, no mod powered, but multifactor authentication is never a bad idea!
I did quit the app and restart.
Have you recently gotten a new role?
not that I am aware of
When I go to my settings it asks to enable an authenticator app? Is that internal to Discord?

Before you get into enabling authenticators...
Did you log out when you quit and restarted?
Were you trying to delete something when the message showed up?
No I didn't log out.

All I can find out is Discord sends this message when it detects unusual activity. It can happen when you join more than one server in a short time period, or you've send a bunch of DMs. I will look further.
I agree with Nicolas earlier in this thread, 2fa is never a bad idea.
I got the same popup, and it did not go away after logging out and logging back in.  I'd like to avoid 2fa if possible, I don't think discord needs it...  any other suggestions?
Is it possible we were accidentally assigned moderator roles?

Thank you <@1267652597804957747> I can't find the cause, maybe a Discord hiccup. None of you were accidentally assigned mod roles. If it doesn't go away by tomorrow, I will reassign the roles you have and see that fixes it.
Me, too. I have the same thing.
My Discord desktop app did an update today, so maybe this will fix your issue. I also reassigned your roles.

<@1268674602931064902> <@1267652597804957747> and <@1269333164703219742> I reset you all back to minimum roles. Let me know if the 2FA box goes away. And then I'll reassign the text team roles that I removed.
The request for 2fa has not gone away, but -as I think you expected- I'm no longer permissioned for most text channels.
Same here - it has not gone away.
Are you using Discord in a browser? desktop app? or mobile? if more than one of those devices, do you see the 2FA on all devices?
I'm using it most of the time in my browser.  I've also got the app on my phone, which does also have the 2FA request.
aw man I thought I was growing super powers
so...you didn't request to be a mod? üòï
I didn't, unless I managed to click a request button by accident.
sadly we don't have buttons for that.
I apologize, I was trying to make a joke - sometimes my humor doesn't translateü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
I got it, I just frustrated with this strange 2FA behavior.
I assume this 2FA notice doesn't affect your usability of anything else on the server.
I report bugs and glitches for my day job! They don't bother me much anymore. üêû
Are you in any other Discord servers? do you see this only in Team Harris-Walz?
Yes, only on this seerver.
correct, I am on other servers and I only see the 2FA on this server
it's entirely possible that discord is pushing 2FA on heavy users but someone mixed up the copy on the notice.
<@568257600228032512>The 2FA box is gone. Please add me back to the texting channels.
Oh yeah it's gone for me too now!
HURRAY üéâ üéâ üéâ üéâ
I fixed it. üòÇ
you have text team again.
Nice job!
It's gone for me, too.  Thank you, <@568257600228032512> !
Gone for me too. Thanks!

I still have it, but since it doesn't seem to stop me from reading posts I haven't said anything. Lol. I'm fine with just ignoring it, but just wanted to mention it here in case it's important that you know it's happening. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

This is really strange. I'm assuming you didn't apply to be a mod?
And you are right, the warning does not affect engagement.

I'm new to Discord (I signed up to do that training later today), but I don't think I tapped on anything I shouldn't have. Sorry I can't be much help. Since I'm new I tried to be sure I was just following the links and reading the beginner stuff.

You're fine, you didn't tap on anything. Mod request are done directly by asking (not buttons). I'll try to get this fixed for you.
Meanwhile I'll share a little video to help you get comfortable with Discord and manage the overwhelm. https://youtu.be/cA32MMsN61g
Thanks so much!
